column4: any way to run my windows vista on another partition in ubuntu?

theoretically the commercial vmware-workstation can do that, but that would require switching between to hardware-profiles if you still want to boot it natively. Far too dangerous (and wasn't vista crippled to not run in VM's BTW?)
well how can I even though it may be a bad idea
you're loosing all restricted drivers from the repos if you do so. Know how to get your wifi/video working on your own?
so give it a try, you can always revert to the stock kernel if you run into trouble
it looks correct wlan0 mac 00:17:3f:c5:bf:91 arp 1
correct mac even, could it be my rt73 module reassigning the interface name?
if not any way to force the interface name to wlan0 instead of wlan1
strange. /etc/iftab only reason for existance is making sure, *this* doesn't happen. Blamng network-manager is quite popular, zho
i removed nm-applet/network manager because it doesnt detect my card
I have googled this and I have gotten other things
wise action, but if iftab looks right, i'm out of ideas
thankyou for your prompt advice anyways, I appreciate it.
as a hint: this has something to do with udev. you might want to read through the udev rules
